title: 113_hr5291
content: The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include a new subheading for the treatment of goods exported for modification and reimported, specifically for textile and apparel goods. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include a new subheading for the treatment of textile and apparel goods, with a duty imposed on the full value of the imported article, excluding the cost of materials like thread, yarn, and fabric. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include a new subheading for the treatment of textile and apparel goods, with a duty imposed on the full value of the imported article, excluding the cost of materials like thread, yarn, and fabric. The product can be exported for further processing under specific headings. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include a new subheading for textile and apparel goods, with duties imposed on the full value of the imported article. Products can be exported for further processing under specific headings. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States includes a new subheading for textile and apparel goods with duties imposed on the full value of the imported article. Qualifying articles from sub-Saharan African countries are free of duties as described in U.S. note 7 to this subchapter. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include subheading 9802.00.70. U.S. note 3 is also amended for the commingling of fungible goods exported for repairs or alterations. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include subheading 9802.00.70 for articles previously imported without added value. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to allow for commingling of fungible goods under heading 9801.00.20, with the option to use an inventory management method for accounting purposes. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States allows for commingling of fungible goods under heading 9801.00.20, using an inventory management method for accounting purposes. Manufacturer's Identification Code is required for textile and apparel products in certain chapters. The facility handling products must be identified on customs documentation or electronic data transmission. The effective date for the identified facility handling products must be specified on customs documentation or electronic data transmission. The amendments made by this Act apply to goods entered on or after the 15th day after enactment. Goods entered before this date may be liquidated or reliquidated if no duty would have been applicable under the new amendment. Requests for liquidation or reliquidation must be filed with U.S. Customs and Border Protection within 180 days of enactment or the entry's liquidation date. Payment for amounts owed must be made within 90 days of liquidation without interest. In this subsection, the term "entry" includes a withdrawal from warehouse for consumption.
